name: F2. Serval and Colorful Array  Hard Version
statement:
Serval has a magic number k (k
ge 2). We call an array r if and only if: The length of r is k, and Each
integer between 1 and k appears in r. You are given an array a
consisting of n integers between 1 and k. It is guaranteed that each
integer between 1 and k appears in a at least once. You can perform the
following operation on a: Choose an index i (1
le i < n), then swap a_i and a_{i+1}.Find the minimum number of
operations needed to make at least one subarray^{
text{ }} of a . It can be shown that this is always possible under the
constraints of the problem.^{
text{ }}An array b is a subarray of an array a if b can be obtained from
a by the deletion of several (possibly, zero or all) elements from the
beginning and several (possibly, zero or all) elements from the end.
